question: How many molecules of water Gypsum has, as a water of crystallisation?
explanation: Gypsum has two molecules of water as water of crystallisation. So, the chemical formula for hydrated gypsum becomes CaSO<sub>4</sub>.2H<sub>2</sub>O. This gypsum on getting heated loses water molecules and becomes calcium sulphate hemihydrate (CaSO<sub>4</sub>.1/2H<sub>2</sub>O). This is known as plaster of Paris.
